subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test first? or Stub first?
msgSnippet: So said  Curt Sampson  on  2003-01-24 --------------------  ... So ... This is the key point for me. My TestCase classes are fixtures; not necessarily
messageBody:
So said Curt Sampson on 2003-01-24 --------------------

<snip />

>Also, I find my test cases often don't parallel the particular methods
>of a class. They test the typical usage patterns of a class, instead.
So
>a test generator would just generate the wrong thing anyway.

This is the key point for me. My TestCase classes are fixtures; not
necessarily in a one-to-one correspondence with the classes they test.
That's intentional.

The structure of the code is a function of the tests; but the structure
of the tests is not necessarily a function of the code -- it is rather
a function of the code's behavior.

>But in the end, I guess you believe in test-first programming or you
don't.

Not necessarily. There's no TDD licence. You can do it sometimes and
not other times. I only wish that those who choose this approach
measure the difference between the two.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
